intro: Xochiquetzallia mortoniana, commonly known as the Mexican fire vine, is a climbing plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshade plants, and is characterized by its vibrant red and orange flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and tend to twine around supports. Xochiquetzallia mortoniana is often found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun.
